cmdp:Snapshot.cmdp:title: Republic_Entities
cmdp:Snapshot.cmdp:description:
The dataset is part of the output of the REPUBLIC-project, which provides access to the handwritten and printed resolutions of the Dutch States General between 1576 and 1796. The resolutions of the States General in the Dutch Republic are a key resource to the political history of this period as they contain all decisions made by the States General (SG), the central ruling body in the Republic.
The dataset consists of multiple data resources, each containing a specific type of entity that has been extracted from the resolutions. The motivation of creating the data set is to facilitate searches to the entities within the resolutions. The entity types are:
-committees (COM) -dates (DAT) -roles (HOE) -locations (LOC) -organisations (ORG) -persons (PER)
Per entity type, except for dates, there is a resource that contains the sections of text detected as referring to this entity type (e.g. annotations-layer_PER), a resource that contains a list of the standardized entities produced by curating these sections of text (e.g. PER entities), and a resource containing the occurrences of these entities in the text of the resolutions (e.g. PER annotations). The entity type 'dates' does not have a list of standardised entities associated with it.

cmdp:TemporalCoverage.cmdp:additionalNotes: The temporal coverage refers to the resolutions from which the entities are extracted.

cmdp:publishingOrganisation.cmdp:Name: Huygens Institute for History and Culture of the Netherlands

cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Name: Rik Hoekstra
cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Organisation: Huygens Institute for History and Culture of the Netherlands

cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Name: Ger Dijkstra
cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Organisation: Huygens Institute for History and Culture of the Netherlands

cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Name: Nienke Groskamp
cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Organisation: Huygens Institute for History and Culture of the Netherlands

cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Name: Marijn Koolen
cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Organisation: Huygens Institute for History and Culture of the Netherlands

cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Name: Esger Renkema
cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Organisation: Huygens Institute for History and Culture of the Netherlands

cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Name: Ronald Sluijter
cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Organisation: Huygens Institute for History and Culture of the Netherlands

cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Name: Frank Smit
cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Organisation: Huygens Institute for History and Culture of the Netherlands

cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Name: Joris Oddens
cmdp:Creators.cmdp:Organisation: Huygens Institute for History and Culture of the Netherlands

cmdp:citation.cmdp:citationInformation: Dijkstra, G., Groskamp, N., Hoekstra, R., Koolen, M., Renkema, E., Sluijter, R., Smit, F., & Oddens, J. (2024). Entities recognised in the resolutions of the States General of the Dutch Republic (1576-1796) [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14577244

cmdp:DataResourceDescription.cmdp:Description: Through an automated process, nearly two million text elements in the resolutions were identified as personal names. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_PER' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same name were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'PER-annotations' (see below). The PER-entities data resource described here contains the standardized surnames to which the 'PER-annotations' data resource refers. The over 8,000 names in this resource together account for about half of the name mentions appearing in the resolutions. The remaining name mentions concern names that appear only once or a few times. These are not part of this dataset. For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: The identification number of the person entities in the data resource.
The standardised surname of the person entities in the data resource.
The entity category 'PER' to indicate this is a person-entity.
This field is always empty in this data resource. In the other entity data resources, it serves as a broad category for grouping entities, but that does not apply here.

cmdp:typicalExample.cmdp:description: id: P0009028 name: Aaken category: PER labels: [empty]

cmdp:safety.cmdp:specify: Some of the names of the person entities may have historical connections to the slave trade.

cmdp:DataResourceDescription.cmdp:Description: Through an automated process, almost 140,000 text elements in the resolutions were identified as committees. Committees consisted of a number of delegates to the States General to handle specific matters. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_COM' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same committee were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'COM-annotations' (see below). The COM-entities data resource described here contains the standardized committee names to which the 'COM-annotations' data resource refers. For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: The identification number of the committee entities in the data resource.
The standardised name of the committee in modern Dutch spelling.
The entity category 'COM' to indicate these are committee-entities.
The labels indicate the broader category or categories in which the committees have been classified by the compilers. We did this to make it possible for users to select committees of a certain type.
This field provides additional information for certain committees.
This field is always empty in this data resource. In the other entity data resources, it may contain links to external datasets.

cmdp:typicalExample.cmdp:description: id: C0000491 name: Algemene zaken van het Bondgenootschap te Lande category: COM labels: Militair, Diplomatie comment: [empty] links: [empty]

cmdp:DataResourceDescription.cmdp:Description: Through an automated process, more than two million text elements in the resolutions were identified as 'role'-entities. A role can be an occupation (e.g. carpenter), an office (e.g. burgomaster), a judicial status (e.g. widow) et cetera. These role designations are typically found in the resolutions near the names of individuals. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_HOE' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same name were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'HOE-annotations' (see below). The HOE-entities data resource described here contains the standardized roles to which the 'HOE-annotations' data resource refers. For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: The identification number of the role entities in the data resource.
The standardised name of the role in modern Dutch spelling.
The entity category 'HOE' to indicate these are role entities.
The labels indicate the broader category or categories in which the roles have been classified by the compilers. We did this to make it possible for users to select roles of a certain type.

cmdp:typicalExample.cmdp:description: id: H0000687 name: aartshertog category: HOE labels: Adel & Vorsten

cmdp:DataResourceDescription.cmdp:Description: The data resource contains location-entities whose occurrences are mentioned in the text of the resolutions. Through an automated process, more than two million text elements in the resolutions were identified as locations. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_LOC' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same location were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'LOC-annotations' (see below). The LOC-entities data resource described here contains the standardized location names to which the 'LOC-annotations' data resource refers. This resource contains all (found) locations that appear more than once in the resolutions and is therefore fairly complete: an identified location was assigned to more than 90% of the text elements that were recognised as a location reference. Text elements where this was not possible were omitted from this dataset. For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: The identification number of the location entities in the data resource.
The standardised name of the location in modern Dutch spelling.
This field contains a link to the GeoNames identification number, if available.
The name of the larger geographical unit of which the location is a part (mainly continents).
The name of the present-day country in which the entity is located.
The geographic coordinates of the location.

This field contains standardised additional designations in modern Dutch spelling such as 'dorp'(village), 'rivier' (river), or 'hertogdom' (duchy) that occasionally accompany the names of locations in the text of the resolutions. This allows users to find all locations at once that were referred to by the States General itself as, for example, village, river, or duchy.
The name of the present-day province in the Netherlands in which the location is situated, if applicable.
This field contains name variants of the locations if they are more significant than spelling variations.

cmdp:typicalExample.cmdp:description: id: L0006160 name: Veghel links: [{'type': 'geonames_id', 'target': '2745726'}] geo_data.region: Europa geo_data.modern_country: Nederland geo_data.coordinates: (51.61, 5.54) labels: [Gebied, Dorp, Kwartier] geo_data.modern_province: Noord-Brabant comment:[empty]

cmdp:DataResourceDescription.cmdp:Description: Through an automated process, nearly 600,000 text elements in the resolutions were identified as organisations. 'Organisation' refers to an official or less official association of individuals that the compilers have considered as an organisation, e.g. a government agency, a military unit, or a religious institution. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_ORG' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the organisation were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'ORG-annotations' (see below). The ORG-entities data resource described here contains the standardized organisation names to which the 'ORG-annotations' data resource refers. Approximately 80% of the text elements that refer to some form of organisation could be identified as a known organisation. The remainder that could not be identified was not included in this dataset. For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: The identification number of the organisation entities in the data resource.
The standardised name of the organisation in modern Dutch spelling.
The entity category 'ORG' to indicate these are organisation entities.

The labels indicate the broader category or categories in which the organisations have been classified by the compilers. This includes thematic, geographic as well as chronological categories. We did this to make it possible for users to select organisations of a certain type, and/or active in a certain region and/or time frame.
This field is always empty in this data resource.
This field contains references to the corresponding locations in the LOC-entities data resource in the case of local governments.

cmdp:typicalExample.cmdp:description: id: O0012032 name: Plaatselijke overheid van Aardenburg category: ORG labels:[Europa, Republiek, Bestuur, Plaatselijk] comment: [empty] links: [{'type': 'republic_entity', 'target': 'L0001312', 'target_category': 'LOC', 'description': 'zie ook de locatie Aardenburg'}

cmdp:DataResourceDescription.cmdp:Description: This data resource contains the occurrences of the person-entities in the text of the resolutions. It contains an identification number that refers to the standardised form in the PER-entities data resource (see above). For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: The identification number of the person entities in the data resource, corresponding to the identification number in the data resource 'PER-entities'.
The reference to the exact location of the entity-occurrence in the machine readable text of the resolutions.
A reference to where, when, how and why the entity-occurrence is extracted.

cmdp:errors.cmdp:errordescription: The entity extraction was performed through an automated process. Therefore, errors may occur. Due to the size of the data, these errors could not be corrected manually.

cmdp:annotationCharacteristics.cmdp:description: Occurrences of entities have been automatically annotated in the text of the resolutions.

cmdp:safety.cmdp:specify: The resource contains derogatory terms for, for example, people of color. This is because the texts originate from the period 1576-1796. In the data resource with standardized terms (PER-entities), these terms have been replaced with neutral terms that were commonly used at the time of the creation of the data resource.

cmdp:biases.cmdp:knownBiases: See above; the resource contains derogatory terms for certain population groups. This is because the text reflects the views that prevailed at the time the resolutions were written.
cmdp:biases.cmdp:stepsToReduceBias: In the data resource with standardized terms (PER-entities), derogatory terms have been replaced with neutral terms that were commonly used at the time of the creation of the data resource.

cmdp:sensAttributes.cmdp:specify: See above: the data resource contains information about, for example, race or ethnicity, but not about individuals who are alive today..

cmdp:DataResourceDescription.cmdp:Description: Through an automated process, nearly 160,000 text elements in the resolutions were identified as mentions of dates. The raw output of this process is included in data resource 'annotations-layer_DAT' (see below). This initial output was then curated. Different variants of the same date were linked to a single standard form. The result is included in the data resource 'DAT-annotations' which is described here. The format of the dates is YYYY-DD-MM. This dataset excludes both dates that do not refer to another resolution and date mentions that cannot be linked to a specific calendar date. For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: Standardised version of a date mentioned in the text of the resolutions.
The reference to the exact location of the date-occurrence in the machine readable text of the resolutions.
The reference to where, when, how and why the entity-occurrence is extracted.

cmdp:errors.cmdp:errordescription: The entity extraction was performed through an automated process. Therefore, errors may occur. Due to the size of the data, these errors could not be corrected manually.

cmdp:annotationCharacteristics.cmdp:description: Occurrences of entities have been automatically annotated in the text of the resolutions.

cmdp:DataResourceDescription.cmdp:Description: This data resource contains the raw named entity recognition output on which the PER-annotations data resource is based (see above). For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: Code 'PER' to indicate this is a person entity occurrence.
The inventory number of the part of the written resolutions in the National Archives of the Netherlands (The Hague) in which the occurrence of the entity is located.
The id of the specific resolution where the occurrence of the entity is located.
The id of the specific paragraph where the occurrence of the entity is located.
The extracted text identified as an occurrence of a person entity.
The integer indicating the start position of the entity occurrence in the machine-readable text of the page of the resolution volume.
The integer indicating the end position of the entity occurrence in the machine-readable text of the page of the resolution volume.
The character length of the entity occurrence in the machine-readable text of the page of the resolution volume.

cmdp:typicalExample.cmdp:description: layer: PER inv: 3794 resolution_id: session-3794-num-150-resolution-3 paragraph_id: session-3794-num-150-para-5 tag_text: sijne Majesteyt den Koningh van Sweeden offset: 100 end: 139 tag_length: 39

cmdp:errors.cmdp:errordescription: The entity extraction was performed through an automated process. Therefore, errors may occur. Due to the size of the data, these errors could not be corrected manually.

cmdp:externalResources.cmdp:extResources: The inventory numbers of the volumes of the written resolutions from which the machine-readable text is derived: https://www.nationaalarchief.nl/onderzoeken/archief/1.01.02

cmdp:annotationCharacteristics.cmdp:description: Occurrences of entities have been automatically annotated in the text of the resolutions.

cmdp:biases.cmdp:knownBiases: See above; the resource contains derogatory terms for certain population groups. This is because the text reflects the views that prevailed at the time the resolutions were written.
cmdp:biases.cmdp:stepsToReduceBias: In the data resource with standardized terms (PER-entities), derogatory terms have been replaced with neutral terms that were commonly used at the time of the creation of the data resource.

cmdp:DataResourceDescription.cmdp:Description: This data resource contains the raw named entity recognition output on which the COM-annotations data resource is based. For the method of entity extraction, see https://github.com/huygensING/republic-project/

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: Code 'COM' to indicate this is a committee entity occurrence.
The inventory number of the part of the written resolutions in the National Archives of the Netherlands (The Hague) in which the occurrence of the entity is located.
The id of the specific resolution where the occurrence of the entity is located.
The id of the specific paragraph where the occurrence of the entity is located.
The extracted text identified as an occurrence of a committee entity.
The integer indicating the start position of the entity occurrence in the machine-readable text of the page of the resolution volume.
The integer indicating the end position of the entity occurrence in the machine-readable text of the page of the resolution volume.
The character length of the entity occurrence in the machine-readable text of the page of the resolution volume.

cmdp:dataSubjects.cmdp:other: Text elements that signal the beginning of resolutions.

cmdp:dataField.cmdp:descriptionField: Code 'RES' to indicate this is a phrase entity occurrence that marks the beginning of a resolution.
The inventory number of the part of the written resolutions in the National Archives of the Netherlands (The Hague) in which the occurrence of the entity is located.
The id of the specific resolution where the occurrence of the entity is located.
The id of the specific paragraph where the occurrence of the entity is located.
The extracted text identified as a phrase entity occurrence that marks the beginning of a resolution.
The integer indicating the start position of the entity occurrence in the machine-readable text of the page of the resolution volume.
The integer indicating the end position of the entity occurrence in the machine-readable text of the page of the resolution volume.
The character length of the entity occurrence in the machine-readable text of the page of the resolution volume.

cmdp:typicalExample.cmdp:description: layer: RES inv: 3104 resolution_id: session-3104-num-179-resolution-3 paragraph_id: session-3104-num-179-para-3 tag_text: Resolutie genomen den offset: 709 end: 730 tag_length: 21

cmdp:errors.cmdp:errordescription: The entity extraction was performed through an automated process. Therefore, errors may occur. Due to the size of the data, these errors could not be corrected manually.

cmdp:externalResources.cmdp:extResources: The inventory numbers of the volumes of the written resolutions from which the machine-readable text is derived: https://www.nationaalarchief.nl/onderzoeken/archief/1.01.02

cmdp:annotationCharacteristics.cmdp:description: Occurrences of entities have been automatically annotated in the text of the resolutions.

cmdp:Uses.cmdp:motivation: To facilitate searches to entities within the resolutions of the States General.

cmdp:SuitableUseCase.cmdp:suitableUseCase: All types of historical research to the era 1576-1796.

cmdp:UseWithOtherData.cmdp:SafetyLevel: Safe to use with other data

cmdp:UseInMLOrAISystems.cmdp:datasetUses: Unknown - then skip the rest of this section
